                        String msg = String.format(Locale.ROOT, "Invalid response content type. Accept=%s Content-Type=%s format=%s",

Generally QL code uses square brackets to enclose values; this makes white space easier to spot and formatting to read.
Also, I guess we want to point out that the request is ill-formatted?
But otherwise LGTM, thanks.

fixed.
We want to point out that the request is not known. Could be a valid format but unknown value.

apologies, I misread your comment.
We want to point out that response content type - which his requested on request's Accept header or format parameter - is incorrect
request content type can be only - json, yaml, cbor, smile - checked when creating RestRequest
response content type can be extended - like in sql
